technology web npm

Publish your package to npm

By Bui Quang Bao | March 25, 2021

1. What is npm? Create an npm account.

npm is a package manager for the JavaScript programming language.

npm is the command line client that allows developers to install and publish packages - packaged modules of code.

npm is an open source project and free to use.

Official website: npm

Documentation: npm Docs

Create an npm account at: Sign Up

Login: Login

2. What is Node.js? Download Node.js.

Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment.

Node.js is an open source project and free to use.

Official website: Nodejs

Documentation: Nodejs Docs

Download Node.js at: Download Node.js

3. Prepare your package

Put all your package‚Äôs files in 1 folder

üìÅyour-pkg-name
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅyour-pkg-name-01
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅyour-pkg-name-02
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅyour-pkg-name-03

Create a package.json file

üìÅyour-pkg-name
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅyour-pkg-name-01
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅyour-pkg-name-02
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÅyour-pkg-name-03
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json

Edit the package.json file

{
    "name": "your-pkg-name",
    "version": "1.0.1",
    "description": "Write your package's description here.",
    "main": "your-pkg-name.js",
    "scripts": 
    {
        "test": "echo \"Error\" && exit 1"
    },
    "keywords": 
    [
        "your-package-keyword"
    ],
    "author": "Your Name Here",
    "license": "MIT"
}

4. Publish your package

Open command line and navigate to your package‚Äôs folder

cmd

Login your npm account

npm login

Note that when you input the password, there is no clue show that you are typing. This will be confused if this is the first time you use the command line.

Initialize npm package manager

npm init

If you have prepared your package, all you need to do is just enter.

Finally, type

yes

Publish your package

npm publish

If you see the line

+ your-pkg-name@1.0.1

your package has been published on npm successfully!

If there is any error, you should:

  • Check your package‚Äôs name, it maybe used by other user (for example: you can‚Äôt name your package react or vue). In this case, you should change your package‚Äôs name, or publish your package under your name or organization‚Äôs name.
  • Check your folder‚Äôs structure, package.json file.
  • Check your npm account.

Thanks for reading!
